metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4488 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in libiberty allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted binary,related to "ktypevec."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

valgrind - 1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gdb - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-multiarch - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-source - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb64 - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdbserver - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

binutils - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1

criterions.comment: valgrind package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2').
ht: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
gcc-h8300-hms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
